page.title: 14Traffic Census in Grampound
page.content: Most families today have a car.A survey revealed that all the families in school had a car.As the main A390 runs through the village we conducted a census to see how busy the road is. July 1st 1985 -traffic travelling towards Truro 11a.m.-11.30a.m.230 cars;21 lorries;20 vans;2 buses;2 tractors.Traffic travelling towards St.Austell-195 cars;34 lorries;12 vans;1 bus.We decided we must do the census at a different time to give a fuller picture. July 8th 1985 4.15-5.15p.m.traffic travelling towards St.Austell-356 cars:14 lorries;41 vans;2 tractors; 13 bikes;3 buses.Traffic travelling towards Truro-299 cars;19 lorries;41 vans;3 tractors;15 bikes;8 buses.We decided that the road was extra dangerous at this time.The tractors show our rural area.
